summary.research_focus: Technical Debt Management in AI and Data-Intensive Systems
summary.responsibilities: Contributions investigating how emerging concerns in AI, data-intensive systems, and other evolving domains affect understanding and management of Technical Debt.

submission_info.pre_screening_process: May take several days before assignment to guest editors

summary.event: Special Issue on Emerging Concerns in Technical Debt Management for publication in the EMSE Journal
summary.description: This special issue focuses on emerging challenges in Technical Debt management due to advances in AI and data-intensive systems.

publication_details.online_first: Once typeset, articles will be published Online and are citable by DOI.

summary.subject: Technical Debt Management
topics_of_interest: Manifestations of TD in data-driven, AI-enabled, cyber-physical, or distributed systems.
Novel methodologies to measure, analyze, or manage TD in these contexts.
Case studies showcasing real-world experiences with TD.
Impact assessments of TD on performance, maintainability, scalability, or security.
Longitudinal studies tracking the evolution and lifecycle of TD.
Tool evaluations addressing TD detection, management, or mitigation.
Studies on practitioner experiences with TD in AI and data-intensive systems.
summary.call_for_contributions: Contributions are invited that investigate emerging concerns in Technical Debt.
